===Etymology 1===
From {{inh|en|enm|on}}, from {{inh|en|ang|on}}, {{m|ang|an||on, upon, onto, in, into}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*ana||on, at}}, from {{inh|en|ine-pro|*h‚ÇÇen-}}. Cognate with {{cog|frr|a||on, in}}, {{cog|stq|an||on, at}}, {{cog|fy|oan||on, at}}, {{cog|nl|aan||on, at, to}}, {{cog|nds|an||on, at}}, {{cog|de|an||to, at, on}}, {{cog|sv|√•||on, at, in}}, {{cog|fo|√°||on, onto, in, at}}, {{cog|is|√°||on, in}}, {{cog|got|êå∞êåΩêå∞}}, {{cog|grc|·ºÄŒΩŒ¨||up, upon}}, {{cog|sq|n√´||in}}; and from {{der|en|non|upp √°}}: {{cog|da|p√•}}, {{cog|sv|p√•}}, {{cog|no|p√•}}, see {{m|en|upon}}.

====Adjective====
{{en-adj|-}}

# In the state of being [[active]], [[function]]ing or [[operate|operating]].
# [[perform|Performing]] according to [[schedule]]; taking place.
#: {{ux|en|Are we still '''on''' for tonight?}}
#: {{ux|en|Is the show still '''on'''?}}
#: {{ux|en|We had to ration our food because there was a war '''on'''.}}
# {{lb|en|chiefly|UK|informal|usually negative}} Acceptable, appropriate.
#: {{ux|en|You can't do that; it's just not '''on'''.}}
#* '''1998''' May 22, "Phoenix Gamma", ''If I was owned Nintendo...'', <tt>alt.games.video.nintendo-64</tt>:
#*: This kind of over-packaging of goods is completely not '''on'''.
#* '''2003''' August 12, "DAB sounds worse than FM", ''Gerg Dyke's Speech at Radio Festival'', <tt>alt.radio.digital</tt>:
#*: so Simon Nelson saying on Feedback "we'd prefer it if everybody listened to digital radio via DAB" is completely not '''on''' at all.
# {{lb|en|informal}} [[destined|Destined]], normally in the context of a [[challenge]] being accepted; [[involved]], [[doomed]].
#: {{ux|en|"Five bucks says the Cavs win tonight." ‚Äï"You're '''on'''!"}}
#: {{ux|en|Mike just threw coffee onto Paul's lap. It's '''on''' now.}}
# {{lb|en|baseball|informal}} Having reached a [[base]] as a [[runner]] and being positioned there, awaiting further action from a subsequent batter.
#* {{quote-web|en|date=2019-02-24|author=Chris Kennedy|title=Aggies Earn Series Win Over Yale in Sunday Finale|site=New Mexico State University Athletics|url=https://nmstatesports.com/news/2019/2/24/baseball-aggies-earn-series-win-over-yale-in-sunday-finale.aspx|text=With one out and no men '''on''', Tristen Carranza belted a ball to the opposite field for a solo home run to put the NM State deficit at just 2-1.}}
#* {{quote-web|en|date=2019-04-06|author=Daniel Martinez-Krams|title=Baseball Falls Short in Game 2 of UCLA Series|site=The Stanford Daily|url=https://www.stanforddaily.com/2019/04/06/baseball-falls-short-in-game-2-of-ucla-series/|text=Although Stanford was outhit 15-6, the Cardinal stranded eight runners to UCLA's three, hitting just 3-15 with runners '''on''' compared to the Bruin's 9-22.}}
# {{lb|en|euphemistic}} [[menstruating|Menstruating]].
#* {{quote-book|en|year=2011|author=Netmums, Hollie Smith|title=You and Your Tween: Managing the years from 9 to 13|publisher=Hachette|ISBN=9780755361137
|passage=It still gets in the way of her doing things like swimming, and she avoids sleepovers when she&#39;s &#39;'''on'''&#39;.}}

====Preposition====
[[File:Encima.png|thumb|A green pepper '''on''' (positioned on the upper surface of) a box]]
{{en-prep}}

# Positioned at the [[upper]] surface of, [[touch]]ing from [[above]].
#: {{ux|en|'''on''' the table;&nbsp; '''on''' the couch}}
#: ''The parrot was sitting '''on''' Jim's shoulder.''
#* {{rfdatek|en|Longfellow}}
#*: I stood '''on''' the bridge at midnight.
# At or near; adjacent to.
#: {{ux|en|Soon we'll pass a statue '''on''' the left.}}
#: {{ux|en|The fleet is '''on''' the American coast.}}
#: {{ux|en|[[wikipedia:Croton-on-Hudson|Croton'''-on-'''Hudson]], [[wikipedia:Rostov-on-Don|Rostov'''-on-'''Don]], [[wikipedia:Southend-on-Sea|Southend'''-on-'''Sea]]}}
# [[covering|Covering]].
#: {{ux|en|He wore old shoes '''on''' his feet.}}
# At the [[date]] of.
#: {{ux|en|Born '''on''' the 4th of July.}}
# Some time during the [[day]] of.
#: {{ux|en|I'll see you '''on''' Monday.&emsp; The bus leaves '''on''' Friday.&emsp; Can I see you '''on''' a different day? '''On''' Sunday I'm busy.}}
# [[deal|Dealing]] with the [[subject]] of, about, or concerning something.
#: {{ux|en|A book '''on''' history.&emsp; The World Summit '''on''' the Information Society.}}
#* {{RQ:Trollope He Knew|volume=I|chapter=Lady Milborough as Ambassador|page=85|passage=[...] I received a note from that gentleman '''on''' a most trivial matter. I answered it as trivially.}}
# [[touch|Touching]]; [[hang]]ing from.
#: {{ux|en|The fruit ripened '''on''' the trees.&emsp; The painting hangs '''on''' the wall.}}
# {{lb|en|informal}} In the possession of.
#: {{ux|en|I haven't got any money '''on''' me.}}
# Because of, or due to.
#: {{ux|en|To arrest someone '''on''' suspicion of bribery.&emsp; To contact someone '''on''' a hunch.}}
# [[upon|Upon]]; at the time of (and often because of).
#: {{ux|en|'''On''' Jack's entry, William got up to leave.}}
#: {{ux|en|'''On''' the addition of ammonia, a chemical reaction begins.}}
# Paid for by.
#: {{ux|en|The drinks are '''on''' me tonight, boys.&emsp; The meal is '''on''' the house.&emsp; I paid for the airfare and meals for my family, but the hotel room was '''on''' the company.}}
# {{non-gloss definition|Used to indicate a means or medium.}}
#: {{ux|en|I saw it '''on''' television.&emsp; Can't you see I'm '''on''' the phone?&emsp; My favorite shows are '''on''' BBC America.&emsp; The Beatles appearance '''on''' the ''Ed Sullivan Show'' is '''on''' YouTube.&emsp; The film was released '''on''' DVD.}}
# {{non-gloss definition|Indicating a means of subsistence.}}
#: {{ux|en|They lived '''on''' ten dollars a week.&emsp; The dog survived three weeks '''on''' rainwater.}}
# Away or occupied with (e.g. a scheduled activity).
#: {{ux|en|He's '''on''' his lunch break.&emsp; '''on''' vacation;&nbsp; '''on''' holiday}}
# Denoting performance or action by contact with the surface, upper part, or outside of anything; hence, by means of; with.
#: {{ux|en|to play '''on''' a violin or piano}}
#: {{ux|en|Her words made a lasting impression '''on''' my mind.}}
# {{senseid|en|a drug}} Regularly taking (a drug).
#: {{ux|en|You've been '''on''' these antidepressants far too long.&emsp; He's acting so strangely, I think he must be '''on''' something.}}
# {{senseid|en|influenced by a drug}} Under the influence of (a drug).
#: {{ux|en|He's acting crazy because he's '''on''' crack right now.}}
# {{lb|en|mathematics}} Having identical [[domain]] and [[codomain]].
#: {{ux|en|an operator '''on'''}}
# {{lb|en|mathematics}} [[generate|Generated]] by.
#: {{ux|en|the free group '''on''' four letters}}
# [[support|Supported]] by (the specified part of itself).
#: {{ux|en|A table can't stand '''on''' two legs.&emsp; After resting '''on''' his elbows, he stood '''on''' his toes, then walked '''on''' his heels.}}
# At a given time after the start of something; [[at#Preposition|at]].
#* {{quote-journal|en|date=September 24, 2011|author=Aled Williams|work=BBC Sport
|title=[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/14957961.stm Chelsea 4-1 Swansea]
|passage=The Spain striker had given Chelsea the lead '''on''' 29 minutes but was shown a straight red card 10 minutes later for a rash challenge on Mark Gower.}}
# In addition to; besides; indicating multiplication or succession in a series.
#: {{ux|en|heaps '''on''' heaps of food}}
#: {{ux|en|mischief '''on''' mischief; loss '''on''' loss}}
# {{lb|en|obsolete|regional}} [[of]]
#* {{RQ:Shakespeare Julius Caesar|act=I|scene=ii|passage=Be not jealous '''on''' me.}}
#* {{RQ:Shakespeare Macbeth|act=I|scene=iii|passage=Or have we eaten '''on''' the insane root / That takes the reason prisoner?}}
# Indicating dependence or reliance; with confidence in.
#: {{ux|en|I depended '''on''' them for assistance.}}
#: {{ux|en|He will promise '''on''' certain conditions.}}
#: {{ux|en|Do you ever bet '''on''' horses?}}
# Toward; for; indicating the object of an emotion.
#: {{ux|en|Have pity or compassion '''on''' him.}}
# {{lb|en|obsolete}} At the peril of, or for the safety of.
#* {{rfdatek|en|Dryden}}
#*: Hence, '''on''' thy life.
# In the service of; connected with; of the number of.
#: {{ux|en|He is '''on''' a newspaper; I am '''on''' the committee.}}
# By virtue of; with the pledge of.
#: {{ux|en|He affirmed or promised '''on''' his word, or '''on''' his honour.}}
# To the account or detriment of; denoting imprecation or invocation, or coming to, falling, or resting upon.
#: {{ux|en|'''On''' us be all the blame.}}
#: {{ux|en|A curse '''on''' him!}}
#: {{ux|en|Please don't tell '''on''' her and get her in trouble.}}
#: {{ux|en|He turned '''on''' her and has been her enemy ever since.}}
#: {{ux|en|He went all honest '''on''' me, making me listen to his confession.}}
#* {{RQ:KJV|Matthew|27|25||His blood be '''on''' vs, and '''on''' our children.}}
# {{lb|en|especially when numbers of combatants or competitors are specified}} Against; in opposition to.
#: ''The fight was three '''on''' one, and he never stood a chance.''

===Alternative forms===

* {{l|gmw-cfr|en}} {{qualifier|some western dialects}}

===Etymology===
The native form in most dialects was {{inh|gmw-cfr|goh|indi}}, whence the variant {{m|gmw-cfr||en}}. In parts of the Eifel, this {{m|goh||indi}} regularly becomes {{m|gmw-cfr||on}} (compare {{cog|lb|an}}). In southern and eastern dialects, on the other hand, {{m|gmw-cfr||on}} may have been inherited from the Old High German variant {{m|goh|unde}} ({{m|goh|unti}}). From these two groups of dialects, the form will have spread, without doubt under influence of {{der|gmw-cfr|de|und}}.
